result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation. Pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.

- NO CONTACT with victim.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.

- Complete Batterers Intervention Program at the Alma Center.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence Lashawn Crampton

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
FOR BRANCH 29.  Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties.  Court found the State has satisfield victims' right law.    

AS TO COUNT 2.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 59 days served.  STRAIGHT TIME.
Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 9 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program at the Alma Center.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with victim.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Received and filed:  Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

AS TO COUNT 1.  Pursuant to negotations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed and read-in for purposes of sentencing.
Branch 29 is in trial and unable to hear the case. Case spun to Branch 12, Judge Borowski's Room 423 of the Safety Building. Parties notified via email.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling confernece held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  PR Bond.  (Terrence L. Crampton - #2022003737, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel needs an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CAL.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
